dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 2805 IH: End Sex Trafficking Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Poe of Texas (for himself, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, Ms. Granger, and Mr. Nolan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to clarify the range of conduct punished as sex trafficking, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the End Sex Trafficking Act of 2013.

subsection.text: Section 1591 of title 18, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(2), by striking or obtained and inserting obtained, patronized, or solicited; and
in subsection (c), by striking or maintained and inserting , maintained, patronized, or solicited.

subsection.text: Section 103(10) of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 (22 U.S.C. 7102(10)) is amended by striking or obtaining and inserting obtaining, patronizing, or soliciting.

section.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Attorney General shall ensure that all task forces and working groups within the Innocence Lost National Initiative engage in activities, programs, or operations to increase the investigative capabilities of State and local law enforcement officers in the detection, investigation, and prosecution of persons who patronize, or solicit children for sex.
